column4: i used linux like over 4years, but i never copied an audio cd, whats the "best" way ?
Sound Juicer is a very nice program
you can rip the songs with Sound Juicer then burn the audio cd with Serpetine
well, i wanted a "one-click" solution in gnome (like k3b)...
hmm, and why its not implemented in gnomebaker ?
i never use audio cd's myself sorry, one you get an mp3 player you dont look back
you mean sound juicer and serpentine are gnome apps ?
i allso never used ausio cds, my GF just wanted to fast copy an audio cd..
sound juicer rips to ogg, serpentine burns the ogg's
you wouldnt happen to also have an xp machine with nero?
i dont have any windoze anyomre
i can play anything i want multimedia wise ;)
yeah, i can play too, but can you make ?!
